p: Urtica dioica roots and leaves have been used by ancient times for the treatment of menstrual hemorrhage, eczemas or rheumatism-related complaints. It has been demonstrated that hexane, ethyl acetate, and methanol extracts of U. dioica exhibited promising effects in endometriosis rat models. After the administration of this extracts obtained by the aerial parts of U. dioica, the levels of IL-6, TNF-Î±, and VEGF were significantly lowered [ 201].
